Portal is the perfect game for fans of Half-Life, or really for any gamer out there. Portal really is the best game I have played in a long time. Starting out in a testing scenario, the strange computer voice never says what happens at the end. Instead of a normal "Play it. Beat it." game, it twists around, making it into a sort of escape room. I would recommend this to any gamer I meet.

Portal is a wonderful puzzle experience that is built around atmosphere. The lonely location of Aperture Laboratories creates a sense of dread as you solve puzzles in the walls. I'm sure almost every gamer has played one of the Portal games at this point, but if you have yet to play it, it's a 100% recommend from me. It's not as heart touching as Portal 2, but that's okay. Portal 1 was never designed to be heart touching, it was meant to get the player to think about themselves and their environment, encouraging them to solve the puzzles in different ways. Recommended by me.

Nunca he sido un gran amante de los rompecabezas pero Portal reforma el concepto y lo utiliza para que al jugador le guste.

Sin duda, un juego muy recomendable no solo recomendable a las personas que les gusta tirarse horas y horas para superar un rompecabezas sino tambi√©n a los jugadores que les gustan las historias y trasfondos profundos.
